name: One Skillet Mexican Quinoa
author: The Gruntled Gourmand
summary: With a large family, I love these one skillet dishes where, for at least 15 minutes, I can 'set it and forget it!' And the kids love it! Serve it for Cinco de Mayo or any night of the week!
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 tablespoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 pinch kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Saute jalapeno pepper and garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute
Stir black beans, tomatoes, yellow corn, quinoa, and chicken broth into skillet; season with red pepper flakes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper
Bring to a boil, cover the skillet with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer until quinoa is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, about 20 minutes
Stir avocado, lime juice, and cilantro into quinoa until combined
